Sentencas: Methanol is a promising fuel for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) because of its low cost and ease of storage and transportation.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: In this work, the performance and long-term durability of direct methanol flat-tube SOFCs are investigated under different steam/carbon (S/C) ratios.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: It is confirmed that the S/C ratio exhibits little influence on cell performance but strongly affects long-term stability.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: The cell is discharged stably under high S/C ratios of 1.5 and 1.2, while it fails abruptly under a low S/C ratio of 1 due to severe catalyst is added into the anode channels to serve as a prereformer.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: With improved internal reforming, the methanol conversion rate is promoted to 95% under S/C = 1, higher than that without extra catalyst and most results reported in the literature, and carbon deposition within the anode is significantly suppressed.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: Thus, no performance degradation is observed for 300 h of discharge under S/C = 1.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol

Sentencas: On the basis of the experimental and simulating results, the mechanism of methanol conversion within the flat-tube cells is discussed.
Titulo: Power Generation by Flat-Tube Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Enhanced Internal Reforming of Methanol
